args.y: Number to be added to x.
Number to be substracted to x.

show_str.description: Shows a string on the screen.

show_mem_str.description: Shows values of memory addresses as string.

args.unlimited: Memory addresses of ASCII codes to be outputted.

show_mem_int.description: Shows values of memory addresses as integers.

args.unlimited: Memory addresses of numbers to be outputted.

args.x: Amount of memory addresses to make.

mem_destruct.description: Frees the memory and makes it no longer useable (Should be called at the end of a program).

mem_dot.description: Puts memory addresses value into dot operator.

args.x: Memory address to put in dot

mem_set.description: Sets specific memory address to the value of y.

args.x: Memory address to put y into.

mem_add.description: Adds 2 memory addresses and puts it into the 3rd one.

mem_sub.description: Subtracts 2 memory addresses and puts it into the 3rd one.

quit.description: Exits the program with the given exit code.
